member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic
member.summary: AgXSAnBasic root interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameter is "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.summary: Aborts the current fast capture, clears the buffer, resets the Fast Capture pointer, and sets the sweep to pause.

member.summary: Transfers the block of data starting at the pointer. The number of samples transferred is set with the BlockSize property. The pointer is incremented by the block size after the fetch.
member.returns: Fast captured block data.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasicSpectrumFastCapture.Initiate
member.summary: Waits for the sweep to trigger and then captures the fast capture data. Sweep is then set to pause. The amount of data captured is controlled by the Fast Capture Length property.

member.summary: Initiate and returns the block of data.
member.param: The length of the Fast Capture in samples (points). This is constrained to be an even number.The input range is 2 to 536 870 908 Samples for internal 40 MHz and 140 MHz options with WordLength property set to AgXSAnBasicFastCaptureWordLengthBit32.
The block size for the Fast Capture transfer in samples (points). The input range is 0 to 131072 or Fast Capture Length, whichever is smaller, with the resolution of 2 points.
member.returns: Fast captured Data.

member.summary: Allows choice of internal fast capture word length. Shorter word length allows twice the time length to be captured, at the cost of quantization noise.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasicSpectrumFastCapture.Pointer

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic2
member.summary: IAgXSAnBasic2 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic2.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameter is "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.IAgXSAnBasic2.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeEnum.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeNormal
member.summary: This is the 'oscilloscope' type of trigger holdoff, and is the setting when the Holdoff Type key does not appear. In this type of holdoff, no new trigger will be accepted until the holdoff interval has expired after the previous trigger.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeEnum.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeAbove
member.summary: For the trigger slope is positive or negative, a trigger event is generated only if the signal characteristic of interest crosses the trigger threshold and then remains above the threshold for at least the holdoff time.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeEnum.AgXSAnBasicTriggerHoldOffTypeBelow
member.summary: For positive or negative slope, a trigger event is generated only if the signal characteristic of interest crosses the trigger threshold after having been below the threshold for at least the holdoff time.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum
member.summary: Defined values corresponding to the instrument SCPI status registers structure.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterStandardEvent
member.summary: Read only Standard Event Status register (8 bit). Conditions defined by IEEE 488.2. Event bits remain set until cleared. Reading the StandardEvent register clears it.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterStandardEventEnable
member.summary: Standard Event Enable register (8 bit). Enable bits select whether a StandardEvent bit causes a register summary condition bit to become true in the StatusByte register.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterStatusByte
member.summary: Read only Status Byte register (8 bit). Conditions defined by IEEE 488.2. May also be read by the Status.SerialPoll method.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterServiceRequestEnable
member.summary: Service Request Enable register (8 bit). ServiceRequestEnable bits select whether a StatusByte bit causes the StatusByte bit 6, Request Service or Master Status Summary bit to be set.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterOperationCondition
member.summary: Read only Operation Condition register (16 bit). Conditions which are part of the instrument's normal operation. Condition bits represent the current instrument state. Reading a condition register does not change the value of the bits.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterOperationEvent
member.summary: Read only Operation Event register (16 bit). Conditions which are part of the instrument's normal operation. Event bits capture changes in condition bits and remain set until cleared. Reading an event register clears it.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterOperationNegativeTransition
member.summary: Operation Negative Transition register (16 bit). If a bit is true, a negative transition of the corresponding OperationCondition bit causes the corresponding OperationEvent bit to become true.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterOperationPositiveTransition
member.summary: Operation Positive Transition register (16 bit). If a bit is true, a positive transition of the corresponding OperationCondition bit causes the corresponding OperationEvent bit to become true.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterQuestionableCondition
member.summary: Read only Questionable Condition register (16 bit). Conditions which give an indication of the quality of various aspects of the signal or measurement. Condition bits represent the current instrument state. Reading a condition register does not change the value of the bits.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterQuestionableEvent
member.summary: Read only Questionable Event register (16 bit). Conditions which give an indication of the quality of various aspects of the signal or measurement. Event bits capture changes in condition bits and remain set until cleared. Reading an event register clears it.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterQuestionableNegativeTransition
member.summary: Questionable Negative Transition register (16 bit). If a bit is true, a negative transition of the corresponding QuestionableCondition bit causes the corresponding QuestionableEvent bit to become true.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAnBasic.Interop.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterEnum.AgXSAnBasicStatusRegisterQuestionablePositiveTransition
